attributes.action: Allow the public to vote no confidence in the government
attributes.additional_details: The public do not have a say mid term on the government. The government was voted by the people but if the government is failing and u-turning on their agenda then the people should have their say. The government is in power to serve the people if the government is no longer serving in the interest of the people then a majority vote from the people should call a vote of no confidence by the people.
attributes.background: Allow the general public to have a say and vote no confidence in the government.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for a vote of no confidence in the Government. This is set out in the Committee's standards: https://petition.parliament.uk/help

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.
